comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: says 6/27/13 reversed along left side, but this is obviously lifted from somebody else.  Might be a copyright date faded out bottom right

comment.author: 35277872@N05
comment._content: rjones0856: These are the four sons of William, Crown Prince of Germany en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William,_German_Crown_Prince The youngest son was born Dec. 19, 1911.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: OK.  But I doubt that Bain News Service added a caption in German to their photos.  It looks like a picture of another picture, probably a postcard.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: rjones0856: The Bain News Service did purchase images from other commercial agencies and then reproduced those images for distribution. This may be one of those cases. A description of the Bain Collection, which mentions this fact, can be found here.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
I hope I didn't give the impression I was shocked or upset by this.  I merely meant that the picture was likely to be older than the date visible on the negative.

Just for the record, by the way, I think this photo series is absolutely wonderful.  It's like getting to go to a new museum exhibit every Monday or so.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The photo, by a Heiligendamm photographer named Beckmann, probably was taken at Heiligendamm, the first German seaside resort and spa. Heiligendamm went into an eclipse while it was part of communist East Germany, and many of its historic luxury buildings were demolished.

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: the fact that the photo refers to "our" (unseres) also indicates it is a German photo Heiligendamm is a resort, photo quite possibly taken at the Grand Hotel www.grandhotel-heiligendamm.de/
